Package org.neo4j.index.internal.gbptree

Interface ValueMerger<KEY,​VALUE>

  • Type Parameters:
    KEY - type of keys to merge.
    VALUE - type of values to merge.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AddMerger, BlockBasedIndexPopulator.RecordingConflictDetector, ConflictDetectingValueMerger, IdRangeMerger, ThrowingConflictDetector
    public interface ValueMerger<KEY,​VALUE>
    Decides what to do when inserting key which already exists in index. Different implementations of ValueMerger can result in unique/non-unique indexes for example.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  ValueMerger.MergeResult
      Result of a merge, i.e. what the (mutable) values passed into merge(Object, Object, Object, Object) mean when the call is completed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      ValueMerger.MergeResult merge​(KEY existingKey, KEY newKey, VALUE existingValue, VALUE newValue)
      Merge an existing value with a new value.

    • Method Detail

      • merge

        ValueMerger.MergeResult merge​(KEY existingKey,
                              KEY newKey,
                              VALUE existingValue,
                              VALUE newValue)
        Merge an existing value with a new value.
        Parameters:
        existingKey - existing key
        newKey - new key
        existingValue - existing value
        newValue - new value
        Returns:
        result of the merge. What the various results mean:
        • ValueMerger.MergeResult.UNCHANGED the existing value will remain unchanged, i.e. no change to the tree whatsoever
        • ValueMerger.MergeResult.REPLACED the existing value will be overwritten with the contents of the new value
        • ValueMerger.MergeResult.MERGED the existing value will be overwritten with a value which is a merge between the existing and the new value, i.e. the contents of the existingValue parameter, as it looks after this call has completed will overwrite the value in the tree
        • ValueMerger.MergeResult.REMOVED the merged value resulted in something that should be removed from the tree. The existing key and value will be removed from the tree
